text: The Commerce Act 1986 is a statute of New Zealand. It prohibits conduct that restricts competition and purchase of shares or assets where that would lessen competition in a market. As well as generally governing markets, the Act gives the Commerce Commission particular powers in relation to services provided by electricity lines businesses, gas pipeline businesses and airports. ==See also== * Commerce Commission ==References== ==External links== *Commerce Act 1986 Category:New Zealand Statutes Category:Competition law Category:1986 in New Zealand law Category:Business in New Zealand
title: Commerce Act 1986
